newsitem.title: ROMANIA: Romania trade deficit $283.6 mln in November.
newsitem.headline: Romania trade deficit $283.6 mln in November.

text.p: Romania's trade deficit fell to $283.6 million in November from October's $301.8 million, National Statistics Board (CNS) data showed.
Exports surged 21.4 percent in November from October but were 2.8 percent down year-on-year, a CNS report said.
Imports rose 12.4 percent in November from October and soared 11.3 percent from November 1995.
January-November exports fell 5.8 percent and imports were 6.4 percent down.
The private sector accounted for 44.1 percent of January-November exports and took 44.5 percent of imports.
Germany was Romania's leading trading partner.

NOTES -- All figures in FOB prices. CNS 1996 import data include oil imports on which custom documents were delayed in October but do not include oil imports on which custom papers were not cleared by end-November.
